reviews.review: This game is really good.  It has hours of fun and lots of replay ability in it.

I have to say that I haven't played a game this complete in a long time. There are a lot of great games out there (of which this is definitely one), but they all have their major flaws in either gameplay or story elements. I would be lying if I said this game is like 100% perfect all the time since that's a stupid thing to claim in any game. However, I can say that it's probably the most complete and awesome game I've played in the last five years.

Cons:

-- The story can, at times, seem a bit emo and saccharine but it really only comes out like that if you're a cynical dick like me. Also, some characters like the Lutece twins are VERY cliche and kind of annoying. Listening to them talk is like listening to an episode of the Gilmore Girls with the cadence of their speech being like it is.
-- IMO, most of the vigors are just kind of useless. I found that I didn't even ever want to use many of them.
-- Again, IMO, the clothing upgrade system isn't very well fleshed out. I rarely ever found myself switching up that much.  This is mostly because a great number (perhaps a majority) of the upgrades are based around using the rails during fights and honestly there aren't a ton of points where I found myself wanting to fight from the rails.

Pros:

-- The story is, far and away, better than any game I've played in the past five years. It is completely immersing and the characters are pretty relateable.
-- The environments are gorgeous and really fun to battle in.
-- Being able to open up tears during battles is a really cool mechanic.
-- To that end, Elizabeth (the character you spend most of the game with) is like one of the only escort characters in a video game that is not 100% useless. In fact, I feel like how useful she was helped story-wise as it made me really want to have her back on the few times she was gone.
-- I prefer buying gun upgrades in this game versus having to find upgrade stations you can only use once (original Bioshock).
-- The ending. There's nothing I hate more than playing a game for like ten or fifteen hours only to have a simple, fast ending. That sucks and it makes me not want to get invested in the characters or story because who cares. This game, on the other hand, had an unbelievably great ending that was cerebral, emotionally fulfilling and just great.
-- The in-game cinematics. There aren't really a bunch of cut-scenes or anything, but the way rooms and environments are set up to reveal themselves to you is just plain amazing. Opening the room in the museum talking about how Comstock killed everyone is a perfect example of this.

In summary, get this game. It really does have everything and is, in my opinion, the best of the series. I really just can't say anything better about this game. Sure there are things that annoyed me, but in the grand scheme of things they are so pitifully minute that I'm embarrassed to care. If you can find this game on sale, get it even if you don't plan on playing it right away. If you can't find it on sale, get it anyway.

Only played 2 hrs of it but thats all I need to recognise this is an amazing game, looks beautiful on any quality, definetily deserves 2013 Game of the Year. One of the best and good looking games I have ever played. If you've got $40 buy this game, if not wait untill it goes on sale because it does quite often for $10.

This games shooting mechanics are subpar at best. I'll just get that out of the way now. So if you want a shotter, this game is not for you. Though it is technically a shooter, t's not a great one.

But pretty much everything else is fantastic. And for someone who enjoys storytelling, this game was really enjoyable, especially the beginning and end. The envioronments are freaking goergeous. And after everything goes to hell it gets even better in that department. The storytelling, especially the ending, was one of my favorite parts. I know it gets a lot of flack for being long, but I loved it.

Oh, and the patriot is a mechanical George Washington carrying a machine turret. Which is awesome and terrifying.
Wow great game, Amazing graphics ,smooth fps, great gameplay very shocking twists in the story and it really messes with your brain. :)  10/10!

best game ever!

So finally after a year and two attempts at trying to complete this game, I've finally beat it. And for lack of any better words, all I can really say in general is that this game is truly a superb action adventure game with a refreshing soty and stellar gameplay.

Firstly, the graphics-they're some of the best I have ever seen, even now which says a lot considering this game is almost two years old and the release of new gen consoles and PC games should open a agte for beautiful games, which they have, but this still looks gorgeous. I have a beast PC so I could run this on Ultra settings and let me tell you, that first glimpse of Columbia and the scene where New York is being destoryed and the city in general, especially the garden sections are a wonder to gaze at, they're that good. The character models are well animated and look good and the architecture is realistically crafted.

The gameplay is very good, not perfect, though. When I first played on my Xbox 360 a year ago, the aiming controls were fine because it was a controllet, but having to press MMB to aim and the RMB to use Vigors and V to melee and considering the recoil early on is high, it was very awkward to use. But thanks to the PC's marvelous mechanic of remapping controls, I changed them up to how I liked them and it felt very nice to control. Game difficulty is mixed, I played on easy because I had played this game up to the near end twice so I wanted to finish it, and for the most part it was a breeze considering it took only eight hours to beat and I died maybe three or fours times, but sometimes it becomes more frustrating than difficult. An example is near the end when you fight Lady Comstock, you have to essentially do the same boss fight three times, which was fine I just wish it had more variety, but the fight itself was tedious because of the repetetive nature of it. It's the same with the large areas with the Skylines where you have to fight Handymen and guys with Flak cannons, it gets annoying but again, they're not so tough so it can be easily overlooked.

Arguably the best thing about this game is the story, it is blockbuster movie quality. At first. all you need to do is catch a girl to "wipe away the debt" your character Booker DeWitt has. Simple, eh? Well as you progress you find out this Columbia is an independant city which is run on a very strict religious system, where the leader is worshipped as a prophet and the US founding fathers are, too. It has a lot of racist and conservative moments in it. You get sidetrakced often from your objective which is to take Elizabeth to Paris. You end up travelling to alternate universes where you are aprt of the Vox, then against it, and alot of things end up different than anticipated. Near the end, you need to kill Comstock in order to stop Elizabeth's protector (The songbird) from stopping her leaving for Paris with the false shepard (Booker). This is when the famous bit arises. After you kill comstock and prevent New York's destruction, you find out that in these "tears", these alternate universes, all have Booker in them. They all start with a lightouse, and ends with the destruction of a city. You find out you ARE Comstock and therefore Elizabeth or Anna's father. And the only way to prevent the cycle of their being a city and a man is by preventing the transition Booker had into Comstock, which is a baptism Booker has after fighting the battle of the wounded knee. So, Elizabeth's and Anna's from that universe kill Booker, thereofre killing Comstock, stopping Anna or Elizabeth being captured and stopping the city of Columbia being destoryed and stopping the cycle. A creepy element is the fact that there os another game where at the beginning there is a man, a lighthouse and a city that gets destoryed, sound familiar? Yes, Booker is the character from Bioschock in an alternate universe. To be honest, I still don't know fully what the ending means but it stimulates the brain and makes you think, and it is a brilliant twist. I can understand fans dissapointment with the ending, as you could say that technically it was all never happened and was a weird paradox, but I like it. The story it tells regardless of it's background and whether or not it all ends up to being one in a million scenarios, the story it tells is a good action packed one with good characters and amazing environments.

I could write a detailed conclusion, but I feel I have done so already. But I will leave you with some good advice: BUY THIS GAME. You will not regret it, a masterpiece that cost only £7 WITH the first two Bioshock's which I will be playing shortly.

A great game and whilst the story isn't as strong as the original Bioshock it nevertheless has many intriguing points. As Irrational's last game (excluding the DLC) you can see their DNA running through it. If you like your games to have a story to it and there to be a point behind all the runnin' and gunnin' then this game is for you.

Gameplay-wise, Bioshock Infinite does nothing new and the AI certaintly hasn't progresssed much since the original Bioshock. However, you may still get a kick out of using the new Vigors on hand and experimenting with them on the new enemies.

I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed the original Bioshock and looking for an interesting, thought-provoking story.

An observance of the insanity in obsessive morally-bankrupt 'American' consumer society. The gameplay experience is shallow but the production values are pleasent enough and the social commentary is reason alone to experience the game. 

Arbitrary and bland gameplay, mechanically dated, lack of varriation in interactable objects, graphically mediocre in many ways, little to no presence of physics aside from rag-doll on entities and some particles...

I am left wanting a great deal more from the title but at the same time I'm confident this is exactly the game it was supposed to be. Which I have found is to serve as a commentary vehicle on art, science, culture, religion, and despite the appearances of a romanticism of 'Americana' some subtext seems almost anti-american and anti-capitalist. Also it should go without saying the game is topically rife with racism. 

This game is a presentation of concepts and ideas about not just being a videogame or the climate of industry of game development - there is a larger commentary being presented about the state of democracy, corporation, and the acceptance of cosumerism. If anything Bioshock is synonimous with extremism taken to the extreme. Take a concept, ideology, or cultural reference and turn it to full and bend that archtype. Then when you have it set to 11 out of 10, push it further to 14. 

The short falls are in place to break up the fast gameplay instances in a set-dressingly delicious cultural backwash fashion. They're ok instances but not the strong points despite the great efforts gone into them.

Loved by many, despised by some, certainly a title to check out if you enjoy a steady and solid FPS romp that sets out to challenge the concept of 'forced hands', which is themeatic to the Bioshock name in more ways that two. Respect to those who made this project. Not a 'magnum opus' but an instant classic all the same - that perhaps in time may feel dated and dry and try-hardy with its philosophical diatribe but until such a day...

Enjoy your murder.

If you've played the previous [b]BioShock[/b] games, then you won't be disappointed with the third and final installment.

Mütləq şəkildə oynanılmalı oyunlardan biridir!

Если бы игру создавал бы Л.Н.Толстой, то бы у игры было бы много частей, как его роман - эпопея "Война и Мир".
Плюсы.
-У такой великой игры, не должно быть предложение, концовку создаем мы сами и это большой плюс игры.
-Забыли про мюльтиплеер - его просто не должно быть.
-Сюжет - это целое произведение лирики.
-Графика, ряд, что такой шедевр потянул на моем домофоне.
-Способности героя, хоть про не которые из них забыли в 1 части Bioshock, но все равно было приятно испробывать новые.
- Хорошое звуковое сопровождение.

Минусы.
- Игра начинает надоедать перестрелками.
- Длительность игры 10-12 часов.
- В городе, которые летает в воздухе, как то маловато видов оружия.

I love Bioshock 1. It's one of my favourite games. But this game was so disappointing.

I didn't get all the way through, so I can't speak for the story (but I'm told it's very good),  but in terms of gameplay, this game is jus awful. It is a repetitive shlock through endless gunfights where the same enemies run directly into your bullets over and over. Combat basically boils down to finding a decent piece of cover, and shooting every one of the dozens of enemies one after the other until the game lets you move on. When you're not in combat, you're walking down long stretches of hallway where occasionally something plot-related will happen, then you come to an open area and cobat starts again. There is no tension, because the areas where enemies will appear are so obviously distinct from the places where they won't. This game basically takes everything that made Bioshock great and throws it right out the window, instead going for something bigger and louder and it fails miserably.

After playing Bioshock and Bioshock 2, I wasn't too impressed, and was surprised at the amount of hype the games got upon release.  I saw Bioshock: Infinite on sale, and saw the extremely good reviews and decided to take a punt.

It's fair to say that this game is near perfection, the graphics, gameplay and dialogue is extremely good, and the storyline is addictive.  I love the scenery, it looks absolutely fantastic, and the combat is very satisfying.

I couldn't give this game any less than a 9.8/10

I will not review the game itself, but 2 of the Bugs:

Mouse follows very slowly, game lags if you play with mouse:
 - deactivate mouse accelaration in options menu (ingame) <<< most important!!
 - set mouse speed to lowest level INGAME (not sure if this one helps but everyone tells to do so)
 - deactivate Vsync INGAME and ACTIVATE it on the DRIVER (forced vsync)

after this, the mouse is still a bit laggy but you dont really get bothered.

@Developer: c'mon, just fix it or change the default settings... does really EVERY customer of your has to google about how to fix laggy Bioshock 3?
Thumbs down for this...

Ich möchte an dieser Stelle einmal vorallem auf die Grafik des Spiels eingehen:
Es ist nicht die super Grafik, mit der andere Spiele protzen können, sondern der hohe Detailgrad und die Liebe zum Detail, die diesen Shooter zu einem der hübschesten machen. Auch Effekte sind sehr gut gelungen und tragen auf jeden Fall zur Spieltiefe bei. 
Auch wenn die Grafik zu keinem Zeitpunkt enorm realistisch aussieht, oder technisch beeindruckt, kommt es doch oft genung vor, dass man stehen bleibt und ins Staunen gerät, weil die Spielwelt einfach so schön gestaltet ist.
Andere Spiele dürfen sich gerne ein Beispiel an Bioshock Infinite nehmen und auch mehr Zeit und Ressourcen in den Detailgrad investieren.
Für alle "Grafikhuren" kann ich eine Empfehlung aussprechen, denn dieses Spiel ist auf eine andere Weise schön, als die meisten anderen Spiele.
понравилось

Hands down one of the best games of all time. There's a reason why this game is one of the well-known games to be ever made. The gameplay is insanely fun, and the plot will take you on one hell of an emotional roller coaster. You don't realize how emotionally attached you are to the characters in the game until it ends, by which time you're left in shock and awe as the plot comes around full circle.

I would recommend this game to ANYONE. It is absolutely amazing and is by far, my most favorite game of all time.
Is echt geil auser das es eben nicht mehr in Rapture spielt
OBRA MAESTRA, punto y final.
Great game...
Loved the game: compelling story, excellent characters, acting & overall theme. Burial at Sea (as a whole) is the best piece of DLC I've ever played.

Bioshock Infinite is one of those rare cases where all the elements of a quality story-driven game come together masterfully. There is no obvious weakness here. BI is the complete package. One of the most immersive experiences i've ever been apart of. Every now and then you come across a game that you can tell that no shortcuts were taken, Infinite is one of those games. I'd highly recommend this game to any gamer out there. More than a game, Infinite is a work of art, a culmination of effort, passion, and a clear vision.

One of the Best Games i´ve ever palyed !

No words need ! youst buy ! :D

This Game is pretty good. You slide around with a hook in your right hand and a weapon in your left while still retaining god tier accuracy, like a pirate with a bad dream, 10% of the game. Also the gunplay is okay. The Story is pretty [i]hooking[/i] and is [i]precise[/i] whenever it needs to be. So overall, pretty good.
Definitely no Bioshock sequel though. A different lighthouse and a  meaningless passage to Rapture don't come close to make this connected to a Bioshock game besides its quality.
9/10 because no Bioshock sequel while acting like a Bioshock sequel, would play again and be upset about again

Ну что сказать?10/10 и это лучший PC шедевр 2013 года,практически без конкуренции.Одна из лучших в сюжетном плане игр наравне со своим предшественником,суперские стимпанк декорации и отличными текстурами,оффигенная шутерная механика заставляющая вас двигаться,а не стоять на месте.Также стоит отметить замечательное звуковое сопровождение+голоса персонажей(Элизабет=Кортни Дрэпер,Букера=Трой Бейкер,он еще Джоэля в The last of us озвучивал).В итоге перед нами точно ЛУЧШИЙ экшен года на пк,и лучшая в серии Bioshock,так что не проходите мимо!))
You will hate the devs for letting this game end.
An amazing game with a really well thought out story.
one word: Awesome!

Еще будучи ребенком я был восхищен Bioshock и Bioshock 2. Все эти плазмиды, город под водой, Большие папочки и затягивающий сюжет не давали мне покоя.
Но то, что сделали разработчики на этот раз - нечто иное, но невероятно потрясающее! Ничто Вам не мешает играть в эту игру без знания предидущих игр и сюжета.
Сюжет, который раскрывается к концу игры сможет заинтересовать любого!
Моя оценка: 10/10.
